Food production may decrease due to the inability to irrigate crops, leading to food shortages and economic instability.
Industries that rely on water for manufacturing processes may be forced to shut down, leading to job losses and economic hardship.
Hospitals and other medical facilities may struggle to provide clean water for patients, potentially leading to health crises.
The lack of water for drinking and sanitation can lead to an increase in waterborne diseases, further exacerbating health issues.
Natural ecosystems, such as forests and wetlands, may be severely impacted, leading to a decline in biodiversity and ecological imbalance.
